subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4
msgSnippet: And don t forget the folks in corporate employment with STANDARDS that say they must use exactly 1.4.2 and who won t see JDK 1.5 for not less than a year. And
messageBody:
And don't forget the folks in corporate employment with STANDARDS that
say they must use exactly 1.4.2 and who won't see JDK 1.5 for not less
than a year. And us Mac using folks won't see it until Steve Jobs
deems it fit for us.

I guess I won't be using JUnit 4 for quite a while yet. :-(

Simon

On 6/17/05, Chris Dollin <kers@...> wrote:
> The main problem I'm going to have with JUnit 4 is not
> being able to use it for Jena for at least a year ...
>
> ... because I can't see that we can assume all (or most,
> or any for that matter) of our users are on Java 1.5; it's only
> earlier this year we dropped support for 1.3.
>
> [We could,perhaps, require all our developers to got to 1.5.
> <fx:thinks/>
> No, I think not.]
>
> Or have I missed something delightful?
>
> --
> Chris "jena.sourceforge.net" Dollin
> It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
>
>
>
>
